name: add_contact

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the contact to be added.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the contact to be added.

description: Add a new contact with a specified name and address.
details: For example, you can send the following command: `add cake to contact, with address '0x133A5b7f583dcd3c1989634345a5a74cc1AFf912'`. This will add a contact named 'cake' with the specified address.

name: show_all_contact
description: Retrieve all contacts, sorted by the specified order.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the contact to retrieve.

name: edit_contact

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the contact to be edited.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The new address of the contact.

description: Edit the details of an existing contact, including name and address.
details: For example, to update the address of a contact, you can send: `edit John Doe, change address to '0x9aF317b7E8cF37B79dD9E945D26bc6C43Dc92191'`. This will update the contact 'John Doe' with the new address provided.

name: transfer

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The destination address or contact name to which the crypto will be transferred. Either an address or a contact name is required, not both. If a contact name is provided, do not ask for an address.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of crypto to be transferred, must be a positive number, including decimals.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The type of token to be transferred. Options include USDC, USDT, BNB, DAI, UNI, BTC, ENS, wBTC, cbBTC (default: USDC)

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The blockchain network on which the transfer will occur. Options include Base, Ethereum.

description:
Performs a cryptocurrency transfer to the specified receiver, which can be either a contact name or a blockchain address. Only one of these is required. If a contact name is provided, the system will not prompt for an address. The transfer amount, token type (default: USDC), and blockchain network (Base, ETH) must also be specified. 

Additionally, this function supports a gifting scenario, where the system can suggest a transfer amount for a specific gift. For example:
- **Buying or gifting**:
  - **Q**: Buy Bob a coffee.
  - **A (empty action)**: Generally, 5 USDC can buy a coffee. Confirm transfer of 5 USDC to Bob for buying coffee?
  - **Q**: OK
details:
For example, you can initiate a transfer using a contact name like this: `transfer 50 USDC to John on Base`. This will send 50 USDC to the contact 'John' on the Base network. If you prefer to transfer using a blockchain address, you can send: `transfer 10 USDT to 0x123456789abcdef on ETH`. This will transfer 10 USDT to the address '0x123456789abcdef' on the Ethereum network.

When using **automatic mode** for transfers:
- **ETH chain** supports: USDC.
- **Base chain** supports: USDC.

In **manual mode** for transfers:
- **ETH chain** supports: USDC, USDT, BNB, DAI, UNI, WBTC, ENS.
- **Base chain** supports: USDC, cbBTC.
reply: You’re transferring {amount} {token} to the {receiver} on the chain {chain}.

name: show_account_info
description: Displays account information, including account details. Use this function to view general account information.
details: For example, to view all account info, you can simply call: `show account info`. This will return a list of account-related details.

name: switch_run_mode

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specifies the run mode. 'auto' will enable automatic operation, while 'manual' allows for manual control.

description: Switches the system's run mode between 'auto' for automatic operation and 'manual' for manual control. Use this function to toggle the current mode based on operational requirements.
details: For example, to switch to automatic mode, you can call: `switch runmode to auto`. To switch to manual mode, call: `switch runmode to manual`.

name: switch_chain

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: Specifies the blockchain network. 'Base' refers to the Base chain, 'ETH' to the Ethereum network.

description: Sets the system's blockchain network to one of the specified chains: 'Base', 'ETH' (Ethereum). Use this function to switch the operational blockchain network based on your requirements.
details: For example, to switch to the Ethereum network, you can call: `switch chain to ETH`. To switch to the Base chain, you can call: `switch chain to Base`.
